Description: Typical range for industrial cleaning of soft stones like soapstone to avoid thermal damage; starting at 100 W for controlled ablation. Max limited by soapstone's low thermal conductivity (~0.2 W/mK) to prevent cracking. Source: General Nd:YAG laser specs from manufacturers like IPG Photonics and academic reviews on stone conservation (e.g., J. Cult. Herit. 2018).
Near-IR wavelength optimized for Soapstone mineral absorption
Beam spot diameter for precise cleaning control
Optimal repetition rate for efficient cleaning coverage
Nanosecond pulse width for controlled ablation of Soapstone surface contaminants
Optimal scanning speed for uniform cleaning
Recommended number of cleaning passes for complete contaminant removal
Optimal beam overlap for uniform cleaning coverage
